alert.note: Alert for Belknap; Cheshire; Coastal Rockingham; Eastern Hillsborough; Interior Rockingham; Merrimack; Northern Grafton; Southern Carroll; Southern Grafton; Strafford; Sullivan; Western And Central Hillsborough (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued March 02 at 2:54PM EST until March 04 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...SIGNIFICANT SNOWSTORM POSSIBLE FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SATURDAY... .A winter storm is forecast to move into the eastern Great Lakes Friday with a secondary area of low pressure developing along the southern New England coast by Saturday. A band of heavy snowfall is expected to lift northeast ahead of the storm, reaching southern New Hampshire Friday evening and spreading north through the overnight. The bulk of the snowfall accumulation is expected with this band, though additional accumulation is possible through midday Saturday as low pressure drifts east. Some sleet may mix in across parts of southern New Hampshire and could reduce snowfall totals slightly compared to the rest of the area. ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY EVENING THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations greater than 12 inches and sleet accumulations up to one quarter of an inch possible. Winds could gust as high as 35 mph near the coast. * WHERE...Portions of central, northern, and southern New Hampshire. * WHEN...From Friday evening through Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...Visibilities may drop below 1/4 mile due to falling and blowing snow. Significant snowfall and periods of heavy snowfall rates will combine with low visibility to create very dangerous driving conditions.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
